problem_text: A group H is said to have generalized torsion if there exists an element h ≠ 1 such that h^{x1}h^{x2} · · · h^{xn} = 1 for some n and some xi ∈ H. Is every group without generalized torsion right-orderable? V. M. Kopytov, N. Ya. Medvedev
answer: No, not every (T. W. Cai, A. Clay, Preprint, 2025, https://arxiv.org/abs/2504.08084)
